definition: to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: I have quizzes and tests all the time.
I think I can pass the quiz this time.
sentences.chinese: 我想這一次我能通過小考。

sentences.english: Quiz scores contribute to students' final grades in Unified Engineering.
sentences.chinese: 小考的成績關係統一工程學生之最後成績。

sentences.english: When is our next Chinese quiz?
sentences.chinese: 我們下箇中文小考是什麼時候？

sentences.english: There are also a few Kanji quizzes.
I will now give you a quiz.
sentences.chinese: 我現在要給你一個小考。

sentences.english: I have a quiz on math today.
The whole class panicked when the teacher said that there would be a quiz today.
sentences.chinese: 當老師說今天要小考時，全班都慌了。

sentences.english: Problem sets will be shorter in weeks involving either quizzes or holidays.
sentences.chinese: 在有小考或是放假的那幾周，作業題組會比較短一些。

sentences.english: There will be two in-class quizzes during the semester that will be approximately 50 minutes in length.
sentences.chinese: 本學期有兩次考試時間接近50分鐘的隨堂小考。

sentences.english: There is a regular math quiz in class on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一早上都有定期的數學小考。

definition: final exam/to take an end-of-term exam/(Tw) college entrance exam (abbr. for 大學入學考試|大学入学考试[da4 xue2 ru4 xue2 kao3 shi4])
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
the last of the three entry-level exams in the imperial examination system of Ming and Qing dynasties
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
literature and language/(PRC) Chinese (as a school subject)
